title: Singapore Art Museum: Learning Gallery Exhibition
blurb: Explore contemporary art with a child's spirit.
description: Rekindle wonder and explore contemporary art with the uninhibited spirit of a child. Art and childhood share a natural connection, involving freedom, curiosity, and fearless exploration. This second edition of the Learning Gallery invites you to look beyond the everyday, experiment with different ideas and materials, and venture outside the familiar. The artworks span diverse mediums and explore themes of identity, home, nature, the environment, people, places, space, and memory. Discover new ways of seeing and understanding contemporary art.
datetime_display: open to discovery and unafraid to try something new?
Keyword_tag: contemporary art, art exhibition, learning gallery, family activities, art exploration

title: Singapore Art Museum Learning Gallery Exhibitions
blurb: Explore art through interactive installations and displays.
description: The Learning Gallery at Tanjong Pagar Distripark offers a dynamic space that blends its industrial past with the arts. It has since become an important hub for contemporary art experiments and exhibitions. Chen Sai Hua Kuan's 'Space Drawing 14' transforms the gallery into a canvas, using a single continuous bungee rope as a line to create a path that traverses and intersects the gallery. Han Sai Por addresses environmental degradation, such as deforestation and the loss of jungle and animal habitats across Southeast Asia. Her intense engagement with nature stems from her lifelong concern for these pressing issues, offering powerful commentary on our evolving relationship with the natural world.
datetime_display: satile element in art—he creates a path that traverses and intersects the gallery by following its contours
Keyword_tag: Art, Exhibitions, Learning, Interactive, Installations, Displays, Contemporary Art

title: Singapore Art Museum Learning Gallery Exhibition
blurb: Explore art through interactive installations and displays.
description: The Learning Gallery offers a unique space for families and children to engage with art through interactive installations and displays. Featuring works like 'Space Drawing 5' & 'Space Drawing 14', and 'Shelter' & 'Land Deterioration' by Han Sai Por, the gallery encourages exploration and creativity. Visitors can interact with the artworks and learn about different artistic techniques and concepts. The gallery is designed to be family-friendly, providing a welcoming environment for children of all ages to discover the world of art. Activities include hands-on art-making stations and guided tours suitable for families.

title: Here’s who I am, I am what you see Ezzam Rahman
blurb: Here’s who I am, I am what you see Ezzam Rahman
description: Here’s who I am, I am what you see Ezzam Rahman. This learning gallery offers a unique experience for visitors to engage with art. The gallery features interactive exhibits and activities designed to stimulate creativity and curiosity. Families can explore the artwork together and participate in hands-on learning experiences. The gallery is suitable for all ages and provides a welcoming environment for children to discover the world of art. The exhibits are designed to be family-friendly and encourage interaction and exploration.
Keyword_tag: Art, Exhibition, Learning, Family, Interactive, Gallery

title: Learning Gallery: Art Installations and Exhibitions
blurb: Explore art installations at the Learning Gallery.
description: The Learning Gallery at Tanjong Pagar Distripark features Space Drawing 14 by Chen Sai Hua Kuan, an interplay of lines transforming the gallery into a canvas. Sai responds to the space by creating a path that traverses and intersects the gallery. Han Sai Por addresses environmental degradation, such as deforestation and the loss of jungle and animal habitats across Southeast Asia. Her intense engagement with nature stems from her lifelong concern for these pressing issues, offering powerful commentary on our evolving relationship with the natural world. Both works challenge conventional representations of landscape by showing nature in its raw and authentic state rather than as neat and carefully arranged scenes.
